tp.pr4.logic

Interface GameRules

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    ComplicaRules, Connect4Rules, tp.pr4.logic.FiniteBoardRules, GravityRules

    public interface GameRules
    Interface that represents the rules of the game. La game delegates the progression of the game in an object of a class that implements this interface.
    Since:
    Asssignment 2

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      Counter initialPlayer()
      Return the colour of the player that starts the game.
      boolean isDraw(Counter lastPlayer, Board board)
      Returns true if, with the current board, the game has finished in a draw.
      Board newBoard()
      Build a board that is to be used in the game, according to the rules of that game.
      Counter nextTurn(Counter lastPlayer, Board board)
      Returns the colour of the player whose turn it is.
      Counter winningMove(Move lastMove, Board board)
      Checks whether or not, with the current board, one of the players has won and, if so, returns the colour of the winner

    • Method Detail

      • newBoard

        Board newBoard()
        Build a board that is to be used in the game, according to the rules of that game.
        Returns:
        Board to be used. The state of the board is that at the start of the game.

      • initialPlayer

        Counter initialPlayer()
        Return the colour of the player that starts the game.
        Returns:
        Colour the first player to place a counter.

      • winningMove

        Counter winningMove(Move lastMove,
                  Board board)
        Checks whether or not, with the current board, one of the players has won and, if so, returns the colour of the winner
        Parameters:
        lastMove - The last move performed. This parameter can be used in derived classes to optimise the calculation of whether one of the players has won.
        board - The current board.
        Returns:
        colour of the winner, if there is one. If not, returns Counter.EMPTY (this does not necessarily mean that the game has ended in a draw).

      • isDraw

        boolean isDraw(Counter lastPlayer,
             Board board)
        Returns true if, with the current board, the game has finished in a draw.
        Parameters:
        lastPlayer - Last player to make a move.
        board - The current board.
        Returns:
        true if the game has finished in a draw.

      • nextTurn

        Counter nextTurn(Counter lastPlayer,
               Board board)
        Returns the colour of the player whose turn it is.
        Parameters:
        lastPlayer - Last player to make a move.
        board - The current board.
        Returns:
        Next player to make a move.
